summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting the interview of an individual, referred to as [REDACTED], regarding a fraudulent investment scheme promoted by [REDACTED]. The interviewee details being pressured to invest $500,000 in real estate 'flipping' deals, the involvement of a lawyer named Anthony Vargas, and the failure to receive the promised returns. The document also notes the interviewee's prior knowledge of [REDACTED]'s settlement related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: The individual interviewed by federal agents. She invested $500,000 with [REDACTED] based on promises related to real estate flipping and celebrity connections, and has only received $30,000 back.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: Promoted a real estate investment opportunity to [REDACTED], used celebrity connections (Snoop Dogg, DJ Envy) for legitimacy, and failed to return the promised investment funds. Known to have received a settlement related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: A mutual friend who introduced [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] and recruited her to be 'sold off' to Jeffrey Epstein. Has known [REDACTED] since she was 14.

persons.name: Anthony Vargas
persons.context: Acted as [REDACTED]'s own lawyer. Met with [REDACTED] to promote the investment opportunity, drafted the joint venture agreements and personal guarantee, and told [REDACTED] it was a 'privilege' to invest.

persons.name: Raashaun Casey
persons.context: A nationally syndicated disc jockey (DJ Envy) whose name was flaunted by [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] to help legitimize their business ventures.

persons.name: Snoop Dogg
persons.context: A celebrity whose name was flaunted by [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] to help legitimize their business ventures.

persons.name: Tony The Closer
persons.context: A social media influencer with whom [REDACTED] engaged to discuss her failed investment with [REDACTED], leading to contact from other alleged victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of [REDACTED] being recruited to be 'sold off' to him, and that [REDACTED] received a settlement related to involvement with him.

persons.name: 50 Cent
persons.context: A celebrity (rapper) with whom [REDACTED] promised [REDACTED] a forthcoming documentary, as part of the manipulative tactics.

connections.description: [REDACTED] promoted a real estate investment opportunity to [REDACTED], resulting in [REDACTED] investing $500,000 with promises of high returns that were not fulfilled.
[REDACTED] introduced [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] and had previously recruited her to be 'sold off' to Jeffrey Epstein.
Anthony Vargas acted as [REDACTED]'s lawyer, drafted investment agreements for the deals with [REDACTED], and promoted the investment to her.
[REDACTED] and her boyfriend at the time escorted [REDACTED] to and attended meetings with [REDACTED] regarding the investment.
The document states [REDACTED] received a settlement related to her involvement with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Execution of Joint Venture Agreements
events.description: [REDACTED] signed Joint Venture Agreements with FROM START 2 FLIPPING LLC (associated with [REDACTED]) to invest $500,000 ($250,000 each) in the renovation and resale of two properties.

events.title: Execution of Personal Guarantee
events.description: [REDACTED] and his wife signed a Personal Guarantee for the $500,000 investment from [REDACTED].

events.title: Civil Complaint Filed
events.description: [REDACTED], through her lawyer, filed a civil complaint against [REDACTED] and his business, FROM START 2 FLIPPING, LLC.

events.title: FBI Interview of [REDACTED]
events.description: Federal agents interviewed [REDACTED] via Microsoft Teams regarding her fraudulent investment experience with [REDACTED].
personsInvolved: United States Postal Inspection Service Inspector
United States Attorney's Office Special Agent
Federal Bureau of Investigation Special Agent

events.title: Promotion and Investment
events.description: Over approximately one month, [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] relentlessly promoted the investment opportunity to [REDACTED], leading to her eventual agreement to invest.

keyFacts: The interviewee, [REDACTED], was recruited by a mutual friend to be 'sold off' to Jeffrey Epstein years prior to the investment scheme discussed.
[REDACTED] invested $500,000 with [REDACTED] based on joint venture agreements for real estate flipping, but has only received $30,000 back out of the promised $600,000 return.
The promoter, [REDACTED], is described as a 'psychopath' who used promises of involvement with celebrities like Snoop Dogg, DJ Envy, and 50 Cent to manipulate the victim.
[REDACTED]'s own lawyer, Anthony Vargas, actively promoted the investment to [REDACTED] and drafted the legal agreements.
After discussing her failed investment with social media influencer Tony The Closer, [REDACTED] was contacted by other individuals claiming to be victims of [REDACTED]'s fraudulent scheme.
